thread.title: Isle of Capri Casino closing Sunday in Natchez
thread.title_full: Isle of Capri Casino closing Sunday in Natchez - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Isle of Capri Casino closing Sunday in Natchez
text:
NATCHEZ, Miss. (AP) - After more than two decades of gambling in Natchez, the Isle of Capri Casino is closing its doors at noon Sunday.
Isle of Capri, one of the oldest gambling houses in Mississippi, first announced the closure and sale of its hotel in August. Isle of Capri spokeswoman Jill Alexander this week confirmed the Sunday closing date.
Alexander tells the Natchez Democrat ( http://bit.ly/1jt8IVN ) the future of the casino facility - a barge with a riverboat replica built on it - is uncertain.
Magnolia Bluffs Casino President Kevin Preston says the hotel's approximately $11.5 million sale to parent company, Casino Holding Investment Partners, will be completed Monday.
The Isle of Capri is one of 18 casinos that operate along the Mississippi River from Tunica to Natchez. Twelve operate on the Gulf Coast.
